text: Property damage is destruction to private or public property caused either by person(s) or natural phenomena, such as severe weather or tropical cyclones.Les Dlabay; James Burrow, Intro to Business (Mason, OH: South-Western Cengage Learning, 2009), pp. 516â€“18 One form of property damage is called vandalism.Stephen G. Tibbetts; Craig Hemmens, Criminological Theory: A Text/Reader (Los Angeles: SAGE, 2010), p. 179 The term vandalism, however, is often used to mean superficial or mild damage to property. == References == Category:Property Category:Crime
title: Property damage
